name: Stockholm
description: The capital city of Sweden, known for its beautiful archipelago and historic sites.

name: Gothenburg
description: A major city in Sweden known for its Dutch-style canals and leafy boulevards.

name: Malmö
description: The largest city in southern Sweden, known for its modern architecture and diverse culture.

name: Uppsala
description: A city rich in history, home to the oldest university in Sweden, Uppsala University.

name: Västerås
description: One of the oldest cities in Sweden and Northern Europe.

name: Örebro
description: Known for its beautiful castle situated on an island in the river Svartån.

name: Linköping
description: A city known for its university and its high-technology industry.

name: Helsingborg
description: A coastal city in Sweden, known for its beaches and historical buildings.

name: Jönköping
description: Situated by the southern end of Sweden's second largest lake, Vättern.

name: Norrköping
description: Known for its textile industry and also as a logistical hub.

name: Umeå
description: A city known for its university and cultural life, located by the Ume River.

name: Luleå
description: A coastal city in Norrbotten, known for its technology university and steel production.

name: Skellefteå
description: Known for its historical association with the gold rush and a growing technology hub.

name: Östersund
description: The only city on the Swedish mainland located on an island, and the seat of Jämtland County.

name: Sundsvall
description: A city known for its stone city center that was rebuilt after a fire in the 19th century.

name: Piteå
description: A locality and the seat of Piteå Municipality, known for its choir and music traditions.

name: Kiruna
description: The northernmost city in Sweden, known for its iron ore mine and proximity to the Arctic.

name: Härnösand
description: A city with a rich history and the seat of Västernorrland County.
